Selected Answer: C
C. Change control process would be the most effective way for the business analyst to manage scope creep in this situation. A change control process helps to manage changes to the project scope and ensures that all changes are properly reviewed, approved, and implemented. This process would enable the business analyst to ensure that any new requirements or changes to the scope are evaluated for their impact on the project and then approved or rejected in a controlled manner. This would help to prevent scope creep and keep the project on track. A configuration management system and a communication plan may also be useful in managing scope creep, but they would not be as effective as a change control process in this particular situation. Sponsor signoff may also be useful, but it is not a comprehensive solution to managing scope creep.

A type of requirements document that would be the most valuable to a database administrator would be:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
An entity relationship diagram (ERD) is a type of requirements document that would be most valuable to a database administrator. An ERD is a graphical representation of data entities and their relationships in a database. An ERD shows how data is organized, stored, accessed, and manipulated in a database. An ERD can help to design, document, and communicate a database schema.

Functional requirements specify what the system should do—its specific behavior or functions. They define features and capabilities related to inputs, processes, and outputs of the system.

D. The system is able to require passwords describes a specific function of the system—authentication using passwords—which is a functional requirement.
Other Options:
A. The system can be accessed from multiple locations.

This is a non-functional requirement related to availability and accessibility.
B. The system can handle 3,000 user requests concurrently.

This is a non-functional requirement related to performance and scalability.
C. The system provides a user-friendly interface.

This is a non-functional requirement related to usability.
